name: places/ChIJoycPFctZwokRZnJHvciUtKA
adrFormatAddress: 180 6th Ave, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Wonderful super clean studio. Sometimes it doesn’t get as hot as it states, but regardless, a very wonderful environment. I did have one awful time attending a live music yoga class where the teacher was rude, had an agitated tone of voice, and didn’t ask for adjustment touch consent. I brought this up to management after they emailed me acknowledging the negative feedback I wrote. They were very communicative in making sure it will not happen again. They also took matters at hand and spoke to the instructor about the issues. Sui truly cares about the people that enters the studio and makes sure it's consistent with the level of standards it holds.

originalText.text: Every single thing about this studio is wonderful. The staff is so kind and upbeat. The layout is great. The design is absolutely gorgeous. It always feels super clean. Most importantly, the vibe is exactly as one might hope to have. Challenging classes but no pressure…. Just love.

text.text: Every single thing about this studio is wonderful. The staff is so kind and upbeat. The layout is great. The design is absolutely gorgeous. It always feels super clean. Most importantly, the vibe is exactly as one might hope to have. Challenging classes but no pressure…. Just love.

originalText.text: An amazing yoga studio in soho. I did their 3 week trial pass and went to so many amazing sessions. I would love to continue going here and their Himalayan salt rock wall is incredible. Their instructors are top notch too, this is exactly the kind of place I was looking for in the city to practice and improve!

text.text: An amazing yoga studio in soho. I did their 3 week trial pass and went to so many amazing sessions. I would love to continue going here and their Himalayan salt rock wall is incredible. Their instructors are top notch too, this is exactly the kind of place I was looking for in the city to practice and improve!

originalText.text:
Sui Yoga is officially my favorite Hot yoga studio in NYC. The studio itself is clean, spacious, and beautifully designed, and the atmosphere is super warm and welcoming.
Luna is an exceptional teacher who clearly has a deep passion for yoga and a wealth of knowledge to share. Her guidance throughout the class was both supportive and challenging, and she created a safe space for us to explore our bodies and our practice.
The heat is usually intense but manageable, and the classes sequencing is creative and well-balanced, with a perfect blend of strength-building poses and deep stretches. I love that there is a variety of classes lore and less intense. I always leave feeling energized, refreshed, and deeply relaxed.
Whether you're a seasoned yogi or brand new to the practice, you'll find a supportive and inspiring community at this studio, and Luna's classes are not to be missed.❤️

The heat is usually intense but manageable, and the classes sequencing is creative and well-balanced, with a perfect blend of strength-building poses and deep stretches. I love that there is a variety of classes lore and less intense. I always leave feeling energized, refreshed, and deeply relaxed.
Whether you're a seasoned yogi or brand new to the practice, you'll find a supportive and inspiring community at this studio, and Luna's classes are not to be missed.❤️

originalText.text: The sensory factor alone gets 5 stars before I even get into how wonderful the entire experience was. Warm check in, wonderful quality mats for rent ($2). The Salt room was wonderful, and the heated yoga was great temp for me and not unbearably hot. Enjoyed the teacher’s instruction. The cafe is adorable too. Sage is burning everywhere, and they have great products, events and facilities.
